For more information, see the documentation Integration with a Service for Electronic Submission on the SAP Help Portal.

I hope you find this information helpful. If you have any further questions, feel free to leave a comment on this blog post or discover more information in the following documentation:

  • German euBP Files 
  • Managing Communication Settings 
  • Process-Specific Settings

entry.title: Important Update: Tax Reporting Date Change for Canadian Company Codes
entry.content:
‚ú®At SAP, your feedback truly matters‚Äîand we take it seriously. Based on your input, we‚Äôve introduced an important change: the Tax Reporting Date will now always default to the Posting Date when creating accounting documents for Canadian company codes.

üìäThis means that SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) sales tax reports for Canada will now use the posting date as the tax reporting date.

üîçWhat‚Äôs Changing?

  • ‚úÖThe Tax Reporting Date is always suggested as the Posting Date for Canadian company codes, regardless of the T001-XSTDT configuration.
  • üõ†Standard Enhancement Implementation VATDATE_VALUES_DEFAULT_SAP from BAdI Definition VATDATE_RULES has been adjusted.

Depending on your SAP S/4HANA version:

  • üíªSAP S/4HANA & SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Private Edition:
    Please review SAP Note 3678561 ‚Äì DRC Canada: Corrections to Tax Reporting Date.
    Changes were made in the standard Enhancement Implementation VATDATE_VALUES_DEFAULT_SAP of BAdI VATDATE_VALUES. If you have a custom implementation of this BAdI, changes will not be reflected.

  • ‚òÅÔ∏èSAP S/4HANA Public Cloud:
    Starting December 14, 2025, your sales tax DRC reports will automatically use the posting date as the tax reporting date.

  • üÜïNew Customers:
    The updated logic will apply by default.

üìåExample:
If you receive and post a vendor invoice in January 2026 (posting date), but the document date is December 2025, DRC will include the invoice in the January 2026 tax report.

üìöWant to Learn More?
For more details about SAP Document and Reporting Compliance for Canada, please visit the SAP Help Portal.

entry.title: Key Apps for GSTR-6 and ISD Management: India
entry.content:
This blog provides a summary of the apps and their functions required to file GSTR-6 in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (formerly known as SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition).

GSTR-6 is the mandatory monthly return for an Input Service Distributor (ISD),  a critical compliance piece for large enterprises with centralized procurement, such as software companies with multiple offices under the same PAN. The ISD mechanism allows the Head Office to receive input service invoices (like consulting or software licenses) centrally and then distribute the associated Input Tax Credit (ITC) to the unit locations where the services are actually consumed.

The SAP S/4HANA system manages this distribution automatically through ISD program known as J1IG_ISDN . It calculates how much of the total ITC each branch should get. This calculation is usually based on a fair measure, like the turnover (sales) of each branch relative to the others and maintained in configuration settings.

SAP generates special internal documents (ISD invoices) that formally transfer the tax credit to each branch. This allows the individual branches to legally reduce their own tax bill by the credit they received.

Here are the apps that assist users in creating ISD invoices and filing GSTR-6 returns:

  1. Re-distribute and Create ISD Invoices
  2. eDocument Cockpit/ Manage Electronic Documents
  3. Resolve Electronic Document Inconsistencies
  4. Run Statuary Reports

              I.                  Re-distribute and Create ISD Invoices:

    This app helps users to create, display and redistribute Input Service Distribution invoices. Users select the filter criteria like Company code, Fiscal Year, ISD Business Place and selection of documents based on posting date. Further, based on the selection, A processing action can be triggered to view the ISD distribution, Change ISD distribution or to Post ISD distribution and create ISD invoices.

     

    App Name/ Launcher Title

    Re-distribute and Create ISD Invoices

    App ID

    J1IG_ISDN

    Business Catalogue

    SAP_FIN_BC_GLO_GSTISD_IN_PC

    Business Catalogue  Description

    Globalization - Input Service Distribution for India

    Business Role

    SAP_BR_PURCHASER_IN

    Business Role Description

    Purchaser for India

     

              II.                  EDOCUMENT Cockpit/ Manage Electronic Documents

    Users can use either eDocument Cockpit app or Manage Electronic Document App to work with electronic documents.

    App Name/ Launcher Title

    Manage Electronic Documents

    App ID

    F4306

    Business Catalogue

    SAP_SD_BC_GLO_EDOC_PC

    Business Catalogue  Description

    Globalization - Electronic Documents

    Business Role

    SAP_BR_BILLING_CLERK

    Business Role Description

    Billing Clerk

     

    App Name/ Launcher Title

    eDocument Cockpit

    App ID

    EDOC_COCKPIT

    Business Catalogue

    SAP_SD_BC_GLO_EDOC_PC

    Business Catalogue  Description

    Globalization - Electronic Documents

    Business Role

    SAP_BR_BILLING_CLERK

    Business Role Description

    Billing Clerk

    eDocument cockpit app allows users to process electronic documents (eDocuments) that are created automatically based on source documents. Users can display eDocuments, submit documents in XML to external systems and monitor the respective status for subsequent actions.

    What are the differences between the Manage Electronic Documents app and eDocument Cockpit app?

              III.                  Resolve Electronic Document Inconsistencies

    This is the app where users can review inconsistencies in the documents for example a document is available in GSTR-6A but missing in Book of accounts or if a document is missing in Tax authority but available in Book of accounts. Users then decide to accept the documents based on available info or may wait for the correction of the records. Only the accepted documents are picked by ISD distribution program. Please note this is the same action you will be navigated to 'Prepare ITC' action mentioned in following  step IV - Run Statuary Reports.

     

    App Name/ Launcher Title

    Resolve Electronic Document Inconsistencies - India

    App ID

    F8406

    Business Catalogue

    SAP_SD_BC_GLO_EDC_IN_PC

    Business Catalogue  Description

    Globalization - Electronic Documents Consistency for India

    Business Role

    SAP_BR_BILLING_CLERK_IN

    Business Role Description

    Billing Clerk for India

              IV.                  Run Statuary Reports

    This is the main App where GSTR-6 filing steps are performed. There are 5 actions/steps involved as shown below:

     

    App Name/ Launcher Title

    Run Statutory Reports

    App ID

    F1515

    Business Catalogue

    SAP_FIN_BC_GL_REPORTING_CN_PC

    Business Catalogue  Description

    General Ledger - Reporting for India

    Business Role

     

    Business Role Description

    General Ledger Accountant for India

    We have gone through the 4 important apps for GSTR-6 Filing. This concludes this blog for GSTR-6 Filing starting from ISD distribution to reconcile and file your returns.  Please ensure you have assigned the required business roles to locate these applications. Refer to Fiori Application Libary for latest information about catalogues, roles and spaces. Further resources can be accessed through SAP Help Portal:

    GSTR6 Report

entry.title: Invoice Submission to the Singapore Tax Authority: How to Automate Invoice Note Filling in XML Files
entry.content:
Are you a GST-registered business in Singapore subject to the GST InvoiceNow Requirement? If so, you need to submit invoice data electronically to the Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore (IRAS). This may include providing invoice notes in XML files submitted to IRAS. This blog provides guidance on how you can automate this step.

A few quick notes:

  • SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition is the solution to support GST InvoiceNow requirements. For an overview, check out this blog: SAP Document and Reporting Compliance for Singapore GST InvoiceNow.
  • This blog applies to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, SAP S/4HANA, and SAP ERP.
  • This blog quotes information from some IRAS guidelines. The quoted information is accurate as of the publication date of the blog. As these IRAS guidelines are subject to change, we recommend checking the latest versions for the most current information.

 

What Is an Invoice Note?

Here‚Äôs the definition of invoice note from TX2 - Annex - Data Specifications, which can be downloaded from here:

A textual note that gives unstructured information that is relevant to the Invoice as a whole such as the reason for any correction or assignment note in case the invoice has been factored.

An invoice note is displayed in one of these XML elements, depending on the invoice type:

  • ubl:Invoice / cbc:Note for invoices
  • ubl:CreditNote / cbc:Note for credit notes

IRAS specifies the scenarios where an invoice note is mandatory, such as credit notes and self-billing invoices. For certain special scenarios, IRAS prescribes their note texts. For example, according to the e-Tax Guide ‚ÄúAdopting GST InvoiceNow Requirement for GST-registered Businesses (First Edition)‚Äù, you must include this exact note text in self-billing invoices:

The invoice is a Buyer Created Tax Invoice. The tax shown is your output tax due to the Comptroller of GST.

 

The Challenge: Automating Beyond the Standard

To include an invoice note in a submitted XML file, you need to enter the note text in a specific source document field. For those scenarios that require specific note texts, it would be a great time-saver if the system can fill in them automatically. The standard solution already does this for these scenarios:

  • Self-billing invoices
  • Customer invoices with the GST category code SRCA-S (Customer accounting supply made by supplier)
  • Supplier invoices with the GST category code TXCA (Standard-rated purchases of prescribed goods subject to customer accounting)

What about other scenarios? Manually entering invoice notes is really time-consuming and prone to error.

 

The Solution: BAdI to the Rescue

You can define your own logic for populating invoice notes using the following Business Add-Ins (BAdIs):

ProductBAdI
  • SAP S/4HANA
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  • SAP ERP
EDOC_ADAPTOR: SET_OUTPUT_DATA method
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public EditionEDOC_ADAPTOR_Cloud: SET_OUTPUT_DATA method

In this blog, we'll show you how to create a BAdI implementation that populates invoice notes for customer invoices (eDocument type: SGC5C_INV) in these scenarios based on the tax code:

ScenarioInvoice Note Text Prescribed by IRASTax Code You Use
Gross Margin SchemeThe transaction is under the Gross Margin Scheme.S1
Approved Marine Fuel Trader SchemeThe Payment of GST is not required under the AMFT Scheme.Z1
Discounted Sale Price SchemeThe transaction is under the Discounted Sale Price Scheme.Z2

 

Step-by-Step Guide: Sample BAdI Implementation in SAP S/4HANA, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, and SAP ERP

Step 1: Create a customer package.

Some objects are created when you create a BAdI implementation. To transport these objects across a customer landscape, create a customer package or choose an existing customer package.

Step 2: Create an enhancement implementation.

In this example, we create an implementation named ZEI_EDOC_ADAPTOR_SG_C5 by doing the following:

  1. Call up the SE19 transaction.
  2. Select the New BAdI radio button in the Create Implementation section and enter ES_EDOCUMENT in the Enhancement Spot field. Choose Create.



  3. Enter ZEI_EDOC_ADAPTOR_SG_C5 as the enhancement implementation name and Implementation: eDocument Adaptor Singapore as the short text. Choose Continue.



    When prompted for a package, enter the package created or chosen in step 1.

  4. In the window that appears next, do the following:
    • Enter ZEI_EDOC_ADAPTOR_SG_C5 as the BAdI implementation name.
    • Enter ZCL_EDOC_ADAPTOR_SG_C5 as the implementation class.
    • Select the BAdI definition EDOC_ADAPTOR.

  5. Choose Continue. When prompted for a package, enter the package created or chosen in step 1.
  6. Activate your changes.
  7. Expand the tree for the BAdI implementation you just created. Double-click Filter Values.



  8. In the filter values details on the right, choose Create Filter Combination. 



  9. In the Choose Filter dialog, select COUNTRY. Choose Continue.
  10. Double-click the COUNTRY filter.
  11. In the Display Filter Value dialog, enter SG as Value 1 and select = as Comparator 1. Choose Continue.



    The filter combination you just created looks like this: 



Step 3: Update the ZCL_EDOC_ADAPTOR_SG_C5 class.

  1. Call up the SE24 transaction.
  2. Enter the object type ZCL_EDOC_ADAPTOR_SG_C5. Choose Change.



  3. Double-click the method IF_EDOC_ADAPTOR~SET_OUTPUT_DATA.



  4. Add the sample code below into this method:
        FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_mwskz> TYPE mwskz,
                       <fs_tax_data_tab> TYPE any,
                       <fs_tax_data> TYPE any.

        io_source->get_data_reference(
          RECEIVING
            rd_data = DATA(lv_data)
        ).

        IF lv_data IS NOT INITIAL.
          ASSIGN COMPONENT 'TAX_DATA' OF STRUCTURE lv_data->* to <fs_tax_data_tab>.
          IF <fs_tax_data_tab> IS ASSIGNED.
            LOOP AT <fs_tax_data_tab> ASSIGNING <fs_tax_data>.
              ASSIGN COMPONENT 'MWSKZ' OF STRUCTURE <fs_tax_data> TO <fs_mwskz>.
              IF sy-subrc = 0.
                CASE <fs_mwskz>.
                  WHEN 'S1'.
                        IF iv_edoc_type = 'SGC5C_INV'.
                            output_inv-invoice-note-base-base-content = 'The transaction is under the Gross Margin Scheme.'.
                            cs_output_data = output_inv.
                        ENDIF.
                  WHEN 'Z1'.
                        IF iv_edoc_type = 'SGC5C_INV'.
                            output_inv-invoice-note-base-base-content = 'The Payment of GST is not required under the AMFT Scheme.'.
                            cs_output_data = output_inv.
                        ENDIF.
                  WHEN 'Z2'.
                        IF iv_edoc_type = 'SGC5C_INV'.
                            output_inv-invoice-note-base-base-content = 'The transaction is under the Discounted Sale Price Scheme.'.
                            cs_output_data = output_inv.
                        ENDIF.
                  WHEN OTHERS.
                ENDCASE.
              ENDIF.
            ENDLOOP.
          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.‚Äã


5. Save and activate your changes.

 

Guidance for Customers Using SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

You need to add the sample code below into the SET_OUTPUT_DATA method of the EDOC_ADAPTOR_Cloud BAdI:

Tip: 
For a step-by-step guide on how to implement this BAdI, check out the following blog:
Enhancing the Standard XML File for Electronic Documents using the BAdI EDOC_ADAPTOR_CLOUD 

 

        FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_mwskz> TYPE mwskz,
                       <fs_tax_data_tab> TYPE any,
                       <fs_tax_data> TYPE any.

        io_source->get_data_reference(
          RECEIVING
            rd_data = DATA(lv_data)
        ).

        IF lv_data IS NOT INITIAL.
          ASSIGN COMPONENT 'TAX_DATA' OF STRUCTURE lv_data->* to <fs_tax_data_tab>.
          IF <fs_tax_data_tab> IS ASSIGNED.
            LOOP AT <fs_tax_data_tab> ASSIGNING <fs_tax_data>.
              ASSIGN COMPONENT 'MWSKZ' OF STRUCTURE <fs_tax_data> TO <fs_mwskz>.
              IF sy-subrc = 0.
                CASE <fs_mwskz>.
                  WHEN 'S1'.
                        IF iv_edoc_type = 'SGC5C_INV'.
                            output_inv-invoice-note-base-base-content = 'The transaction is under the Gross Margin Scheme.'.
                            cs_output_data = output_inv.
                        ENDIF.
                  WHEN 'Z1'.
                        IF iv_edoc_type = 'SGC5C_INV'.
                            output_inv-invoice-note-base-base-content = 'The Payment of GST is not required under the AMFT Scheme.'.
                            cs_output_data = output_inv.
                        ENDIF.
                  WHEN 'Z2'.
                        IF iv_edoc_type = 'SGC5C_INV'.
                            output_inv-invoice-note-base-base-content = 'The transaction is under the Discounted Sale Price Scheme.'.
                            cs_output_data = output_inv.
                        ENDIF.
                  WHEN OTHERS.
                ENDCASE.
              ENDIF.
            ENDLOOP.
          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.

 

Wrapping Up

Hope this blog is helpful for you. We'd love to hear feedback from you. Feel free to share comments below. Let's learn from each other!

To learn more about the solution, refer to the following documentation on SAP Help Portal, which covers business task procedures, configuration, and more:

ProductDocumentation Links
SAP S/4HANA, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  • Electronic Customer Invoices: Submission to the Tax Authority
  • Electronic Supplier Invoices: Submission to the Tax Authority
SAP ERP
  • Electronic Customer Invoices: Submission to the Tax Authority
  • Electronic Supplier Invoices: Submission to the Tax Authority
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Electronic Customer Invoices: Submission to the Tax Authority
  • Electronic Supplier Invoices: Submission to the Tax Authority

entry.title: KSeF 2.0: Certificate & Authorization for Establishing Connection with the Cloud Edition
entry.content:
The Polish authorities have postponed their original plan to introduce mandatory e-invoices through KSeF in 2024. This delay has been used to rebuild the infrastructure and launch KSeF 2.0, bringing significant changes to the authentication process, meaning the following: 

    • For KSeF 1.0, you used a token-based authentication. This method will be phased out by 2026. 
    • For KSeF 2.0, you, as an SAP customer, use a certificate-based authentication. 

    This blog post guides you through the steps of authenticating your system with the KSeF  2.0 environment. As a prerequisite, you have already performed the general integration settings as described in this blog post:‚ÄØKSeF 2.0: Setup and Integrate Your System with the Cloud Edition. 

     

    KSeF Environments  

    KSeF 2.0 operates across three different environments, as follows: 

    Test Environment 

    • Supports both FA (2) and FA (3) schemas 
    • Flexible authentication - can work without real certificates, only an auto-generated certificate in the API 
    • Ideal for initial development and testing 
    • Connects with the test plan of the cloud edition 

    Note: You only need to create a communication setting associated with your NIP number, uploading certificates is not necessary. However, if you choose to upload a certificate, the system considers your certificate for the authentication. 

    Pre-production (Demo) Environment 

    • Supports only FA (3) schema 
    • Requires certificate authentication 
    • Mirror of production for final validation 
    • Connects with the test plan of the cloud edition 

    Production Environment 

    • Supports only FA (3) 
    • Requires certificate authentication 
    • Live operational system 
    • Connects with the standard plan of the cloud edition 

    Note: The FA (3) schema version supports structured invoice attachments, but their use requires approval from the Ministry of Finance. ‚ÄØ 

     

    Certificate and Key 

    KSeF certificates are generated through dedicated applications provided by the Polish Ministry of Finance. The application you use depends on your target environment: 

    • Test and Pre-production Environments: Use the KSeF 2.0 app 
    • Production Environment: Use the MCU (Modu≈Ç Certyfikat√≥w i Uprawnie≈Ñ) app until the KSeF 2.0 app becomes available for production 

    To access these applications and generate your certificate, you authenticate using different methods depending on whether you're logging in as a physical person or as a company. 

    Login as a Physical Person 

    If you authenticate as an individual, you have the following two options: 

    Electronic Trusted Profile  

    • A fast and free authentication method for individuals 
    • No purchase required 

    Qualified Electronic Signature 

    • Purchased from a certification authority 
    • The primary method before Electronic Trusted Profile was introduced 

    Note: When using either of these methods, the generated certificate is linked to the NIP of the person authenticating to the KSeF 2.0 app or MCU app. This means: 

    • All invoices signed with this certificate are linked to the personal NIP 
    • The company must submit the ZAW-FA form to associate the company with the authenticated person 
    • Only one person can be authorized through the ZAW-FA form 
    • This authorized person can then grant permissions to other employees within the company 

     Login as a Company 

    Qualified Electronic Seal 

    • Used by organizations and based on the entity's Tax Identification Number 
    • Purchased from a certification authority 
    • Not a new requirement introduced by KSeF, but many companies may not have one yet 

    Note: When using a qualified electronic seal, the generated certificate is linked to the company's NIP, which means: 

    • The ZAW-FA form is not required 
    • Invoices are issued in the name of the company without any reference to a personal NIP 
    • This provides a cleaner separation between company operations and individual employees 

     

    Use the following links to access the appropriate KSeF application for your environment: 

    • Test Environment: KSeF 2.0 Test App 
    • Pre-production (Demo) Environment: KSeF 2.0 Demo App 
    • Production Environment: MCU App 

    For additional guidance and support, the Ministry of Finance provides comprehensive e-learning materials through their "≈örody z KSeF" (Wednesdays with KSeF) program. Access these resources at: KSeF E-Learning Portal 

     

    SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition requires valid KSeF certificates regardless of the authentication method you used to access the KSeF 2.0 app or MCU app. Whether you authenticated as a physical person or as a company, ensure you have generated both the certificate and key files from the tax authority portal before proceeding with system configuration. 

    You can learn more about how to submit applications for certificates and download certificates from the KSeF portal. For more information, see Modu≈Ç Certyfikat√≥w i Uprawnie≈Ñ (MCU). 

     Note: The duration of the authentication process in the KSeF System Certificates and Entitlements Module (MCU) using a qualified certificate depends on the issuer of the given certificate (CA - Certification Authority). 

    KSeF verifies the validity of the certificate through the services provided by the relevant certification center. In the event of temporary unavailability or delays on the part of the certificate issuer, the authentication time may be extended. 

    We emphasize that: 

    • KSeF is not responsible for the duration of the certificate verification, 
    • login delays are due to the operation of external services provided by certificate issuers. 

    Before configuring your system, ensure you have generated the certificate and key files from the tax authority portal. 

     

     System Configuration 

    To upload your certificate and key, perform the following steps: 

     1. In the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition launchpad, access the Manage Communication Settings - External Parties‚ÄØapp and create a communication setting. 

    1. Give the communication setting a name. 
    2. Select the E-Invoices Through KSeF 2.0 (PL) communication type. 
    3. Enter the NIP number as the identification number. 
    4. Choose‚ÄØCreate.

     2. Open your communication setting and choose "Client Certificate and Key" as the authentication setting. 

     3. Enter the certificate and key generated from the tax authority portal, along with the password: 

    • For Certificate, upload the .crt file. 
    • For Key, upload the .key file. 

     4. For test or pre-prod environment only: Under Additional Properties, add Tax Authority System with value "test" or "pre-prod" to indicate test or pre-production environment, respectively. 

    5. (Relevant only for customer invoices) Create an additional communication setting to enable the offline mode.

    1. Give the communication setting a name. 
    2. Select the E-Invoices Through KSeF 2.0 (PL) - QR Code communication type. 
    3. Enter the NIP number as the identification number. 
    4. Choose‚ÄØCreate.

    6. Open your communication setting and choose "Client Certificate and Key" as the authentication setting. 

    7. Enter the certificate and key generated from the tax authority portal, along with the password: 

    • For Certificate, upload the .crt file. 
    • For Key, upload the .key file. 

     

    Note that previously, you were able to connect with the test environment of KSeF 2.0 without creating a communication setting in the Manage Communication Settings app. Now, you need a communication setting. This means the following:

    • If you have a communication setting for E-Invoices Through KSeF 2.0 (PL) without a certificate and have added "test" as Tax Authority System for the additional property, you connect to the test environment of KSeF 2.0 with self-generated certificate.
    • If you have a communication setting for E-Invoices Through KSeF 2.0 (PL) with certificates and have added ‚Äútest‚Äù as Tax Authority System for the additional property, you connect to the test environment of KSeF 2.0 with your certificate.
    • If you have a communication setting for E-Invoices Through KSeF 2.0 (PL) with certificates and have added ‚Äúpre-prod‚Äù as Tax Authority System for the additional property, you connect to the pre-prod environment of KSeF 2.0.

    It is not possible to connect to the test environment of KSeF 2.0 without maintaining the additional property.

    For more information, access our official documentation on the SAP Help Portal. See Managing Communication Settings | SAP Help Portal.

entry.title: Legal Change - YATIRIMTESVIK scenario support through Extensibility in DRC T√ºrkiye
entry.content:
This blog post introduces a guide on how to implement the new legal requirement released by GIB (GELƒ∞R ƒ∞DARESƒ∞ BA≈ûKANLIƒûI) for invoices issued under a valid Investment Incentive Certificate (Yatƒ±rƒ±m Te≈üvik Belgesi ‚Äì YTB) through Developer Extensibility for Document and Reporting Compliance T√ºrkiye in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.


Background 
We have already published a Developer Extensibility for Document and Reporting Compliance T√ºrkiye in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud on how S/4HANA Public Cloud customers can leverage developer extensibility to modify content of XMLs produced during electronic invoice submissions, pertaining to specific business and legal requirements.

Note for: SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud and ECC environments: 

In SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud and ECC environments, the exact same process exists through extensibility, however the BAdi implementation would have to be done for EDOC_ADAPTOR instead of EDOC_ADAPTOR_CLOUD.

What‚Äôs New? 
GIB has published a legal requirement pertaining to invoices issued under valid Investment Incentive Certificate which impacts a few companies on 21st November, 2025. In this blog we would aim to address the requirement through the learnings of the previous blog highlighted in the background.

What‚Äôs the technical specifications of the requirement? 
Currently system does not automatically determine whether a billing or finance document is YTB-related or not. The customer must explicitly indicate that the invoice belongs to a YTB investment project and provide the necessary values. As part of the legal requirement authority following is an easy requirement with an UBL (Universal Business Language, an ISO standard XML) representation:

  • New Profile IDs
    • YATIRIMTESVIK ‚Äì for eInvoicing scenarios 
    • EARSIVFATURA ‚Äì for eArchive scenarios 
  • New Invoice Type Codes under each invoicing scenarios
    • YATIRIMTESVIK ‚Äì for eInvoicing scenarios.
      • SATIS ‚Äì Sales invoices
      • ISTISNA ‚Äì Exception invoices
      • IADE ‚Äì Refund or Return invoices
    • EARSIVFATURA ‚Äì for eArchive scenarios
      • YTBSATIS ‚Äì consumer/eArchive sales invoice 
      • YTBISTISNA ‚Äì consumer/eArchive exception invoices
      • YTBIADE ‚Äì consumer/eArchive refund/return invoices
  • Mapping of new identification tag - ContractDocumentReference 
    • ID field should be the filled up with the incentive certificate number
      • schemeID of this would be "YTBNO"
    • IssueDate should be filled up with the investment certificate date in DD/MM/YYYY format 
  • Adjustments to existing tag - TaxTotal 
    • The waived VAT amount should be shown in XPath TaxTotal/TaxSubtotal/TaxAmount only if profileID is YATIRIMTESVIK with invoice type value is ISTISNA, or profileID is EARSIVFATURA with invoice type value is YTBISTISNA.
    • Reason codes similar to tax exemption reason codes have been introduced as part of the technical structure from GIB available at their website. These reason codes have to be filled in XPath TaxTotal/TaxSubtotal/TaxCategory/TaxExemptionReasonCode.
    • Subsequently new reason code descriptions have also been introduced as part of the technical structure which should go in the XPath TaxTotal/TaxSubtotal/TaxCategory/TaxExemptionReason corresponding the reason code filled in above step.
  • Adjustments to existing tag - InvoiceLine 
    • For YTB related scenarios the XPath tag InvoiceLine/Item/CommodityClassification/ItemClassificationCode should be filled with 01, 02, 03, or 04 in case of the scenario of profile ID of YATIRIMTESVIK/EARSIVFATURA.
    • In case the ItemClassificationCode is 01 (Machine Equipment), and reason code in TaxExemptionReason is 308 as per the legal requirement, then
      • XPath tag InvoiceLine/Item/Name should be filled with machin name
      • XPath tag InvoiceLine/Item/ItemInstance/Name should be filled with Machine ID.
      • XPath tag InvoiceLine/Item/ItemInstance/ProductTraceID should be filled with the Machine Sequence Number/Equivalent details

How does a sample code looks like using Developer Extensibility?

The prerequisites, roles and BAdI Enhancement Implementation names have already been mentioned in our previous blog (details - Developer Extensibility for Document and Reporting Compliance T√ºrkiye in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud ).

Let's illustrate how this can be tailored to suit the above legal requirement.

    FIELD-SYMBOLS:
      <lfs_cs_doc_data>      TYPE edo_tr_inv_ubl_format_req,
      <fs_invoice_tab>       TYPE edo_tr_e_doc_turkey_invoic_tab,
      <fs_invoice_el>        TYPE edo_tr_e_doc_turkey_invoice_el,
      <fs_payment_means_tab> TYPE edo_tr_payment_means_tab,
      <fs_add_doc_ref>       TYPE edo_tr_additional_document_tab.

    ASSIGN COMPONENT 'DOC_DATA' OF STRUCTURE cs_output_data TO FIELD-SYMBOL(<lv_data>).
    IF <lv_data> IS ASSIGNED.
      IF iv_edoc_type = 'TR_BINV'. "Turkey Basic eInvoice
        IF iv_interface_id NE 'TR_GETSTATUS_REQ'.
          ASSIGN COMPONENT 'PARAMETERS' OF STRUCTURE cs_output_data TO <lv_data>.
          IF <lv_data> IS ASSIGNED.
            ASSIGN cs_output_data TO <lfs_cs_doc_data>.
            IF <lfs_cs_doc_data> IS ASSIGNED.
              ASSIGN <lfs_cs_doc_data>-parameters-package-elements TO <fs_invoice_tab>.
              IF <fs_invoice_tab> IS ASSIGNED.
                LOOP AT <fs_invoice_tab> ASSIGNING <fs_invoice_el>.
* This is just a sample implementation, you can decide on the conditional assignment based on your business needs.
                  <fs_invoice_el>-element_list-invoice-profile_id-base-base-content = 'YATIRIMTESVIK'.
                  <fs_invoice_el>-element_list-invoice-invoice_type_code-base-base-content = 'SATIS'.
" Filling up ContractDocumentReference
                  <fs_invoice_el>-element_list-invoice-contract_document_reference =
                    VALUE #( ( id-base-base-content = '1234567890'
                               id-base-base-scheme_id = 'YTBNO'
                               issue_date-base-content = '19990912' ) ).
" Filling up TaxTotal
                  <fs_invoice_el>-element_list-invoice-tax_total =
                    VALUE #( ( tax_subtotal =
                    VALUE #( ( tax_amount-base-content = '123.40'
                               tax_amount-base-currency_id = 'TRY'
                               tax_category-tax_exemption_reason_code-base-base-content = '308'
                               tax_category-tax_exemption_reason-base-base-content = 'Delivery of Investment Goods under Incentive Scheme 13/d' ) ) ) ).
" Filling up InvoiceLine
                  LOOP AT <fs_invoice_el>-element_list-invoice-invoice_line ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<lfs_invoice_line>).
                    <lfs_invoice_line>-item-commodity_classification = VALUE #( ( item_classification_code-base-base-content = '01' ) ).
                    READ TABLE <lfs_invoice_line>-item-commodity_classification ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<lfs_comm_class>)
                      WITH KEY item_classification_code-base-base-content = '01'.
                    IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
                      <lfs_invoice_line>-item-name-base-base-content = 'Machine Name'.
                      <lfs_invoice_line>-item-item_instance = VALUE #( ( serial_id-base-base-content = '9999999999'
                                                                         product_trace_id-base-base-content = '7878787878787878' ) ).
                    ENDIF.
                  ENDLOOP.
                ENDLOOP.
              ENDIF.
            ENDIF.
          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.

 

Spoiler
Disclaimer - This is just a sample code; actual business conditions are not depicted through this.

Disclaimer - This is just a sample code; actual business conditions are not depicted through this.

Result: 

When you display the XML file of the electronic document in the‚ÄØeDocument Cockpit‚ÄØ(EDOC_COCKPIT) corresponding to the above invoicing scenario, you will see that the mentioned tags populated. Please note that based on actual submission of this document to authorized service provider, error handling and troubleshooting can be tackled.

Conclusion 
With recent enhancements to the T√ºrkiye Document and Reporting Compliance solution, SAP has made it significantly easier to cater to targeted and industry specific legal requirements in electronic document outputs. 

This improvement gives you more flexibility and helps ensure compliance with T√ºrkiye‚Äôs legal requirements. This blog is the first of the many blogs coming up to demonstrate legal requirements in an easy consumable way
